page.title: 12GRANGE QUARRY EARDINGTON
page.content: Grange Quarry was started in{1948 by {J Cross and Sons}from Wolverhampton.In {1967}R.M.C. added the concrete plant, then in{1976}it was bought by Redland Aggregates. { Sand and gravel}is excavated from a number of quarries in Shropshire including Grange Quarry.The material is then brought to the{Grange Quarry {washing,screening and grading plant. It is washed and screened to remove all the impurities,it is then graded for different types of gravel.The silt from the plant is used for reclamation of land. The concrete from the plant is used for construction and agricultural use. Also concrete from the plant was used in the construction af the new by-pass at Bridgnorth.There is a quarry due to be opened at Hampton Loade with a life of 20 years.
